name: John Amanatides
content: John Amanatides Electrical Engineering and Computer Science John Amanatides Who I Am I'm an Associate Professor in the Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science at York University. I graduated with a PhD from the University of Toronto in 1989 and did a post-doc at AT&T Bell Labs, Murray Hill, for a year and a half. I came to York in 1990. I no longer supervise graduate students. My Research Interests Computer graphics. Realistic image synthesis. Ray tracing, shading, illuminant models, antialiasing. Here are my publications and some images that I've created over the years. Also available is a copy of the Siggraph 1989 animation "Megacycles". What I'm Teaching This term I'm teaching EECS 1540A TR2:30. How To Reach Me Lassonde 215 120 Campus Walk York University North York, Ontario M3J 1P3 Canada E-mail: amana@yorku.ca Revised: Sept 22, 2025
